meanings.definition: To discount (a negotiable instrument) a second time.
meanings.sent1: The bank rediscounted the loan after the borrower made a late payment.
meanings.sent2: She rediscounted the check at a lower rate to save money.
meanings.sent3: The teacher rediscounted the homework assignment after the student spilled juice on it.
meanings.sent4: The chef rediscounted the recipe to make it healthier for the customers.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic rediscounted the repair cost for the loyal customer.

meanings.definition: To discount (a negotiable instrument) for a second time.
meanings.sent1: He rediscounted the bond to get a better return on investment.
meanings.sent2: They rediscounted the promissory note to adjust for the new interest rate.
meanings.sent3: The artist rediscounted the painting after realizing a mistake in the pricing.
meanings.sent4: The gardener rediscounted the plant prices for the end-of-season sale.
meanings.sent5: She rediscounted the ticket price for the charity event to attract more attendees.
